sources.title: The Devil Doll (1936)
sources.description: The Devil-Doll is a 1936 American horror film directed by Tod Browning and starring Lionel Barrymore and Maureen O'Sullivan. The film was adapted from the novel Burn Witch Burn! by Abraham Merritt. In the film, an escaped convict named Paul Lavond seeks revenge on the associates who framed him for robbery and murder. Using a scientist's shrinking formula, he disguises himself as an old woman selling dolls and employs the technique to infiltrate the homes of his enemies, ultimately clearing his name and reconnecting with his estranged daughter.

metadata.Plot: Paul Lavond was a respected banker in Paris when he was framed for robbery and murder by crooked associates and sent to prison. Years later, he escapes with a friend, a scientist who was working on a method to reduce humans to a height of mere inches (all for the good of humanity, of course). Lavond however is consumed with hatred for the men who betrayed him, and takes the scientist's methods back to Paris to exact painful revenge.
metadata.Writer: Garrett Fort, Guy Endore, Erich von Stroheim
metadata.Actors: Lionel Barrymore, Maureen O'Sullivan, Frank Lawton
